title: üß™üöÄ Basic Forecasting in Magic ETL üöÄüß™
author: Jae Myong Wilson
content_markdown:
Why do we do Forecasting?¬† To predict the future.

FOLLOW-UP QUESTION (that we always forget to ask).

üîÆüé¥ How good are we at predicting the future? üîÆüé¥

Free YouTube Full TutorialÔªø

Ôªø
** note, my video won't show you how to make a "good" forecast, or "performance tune" your forecast.¬† Instead it focuses on how you should consider structuring your data in Domo.¬† Which forecasting model you use is up to you, you could try rolling 90, rolling 30, naive etc.

How do you know which forecast to use?¬† Check out the segment where I talk about Cost Equations.

## CRITICAL CONCEPTS

## Unit of Analysis

Forecasting applies ‚Äúcrazy math‚Äù to a dataset to predict ‚Äúthe next row of data‚Äù

- The INPUT must be at the same granularity as the OUTPUT

Aggregate your Data to the same granularity.¬† If the data is at the transactional level, use a GROUP BY tile.Ôªø
![](https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/HFAPOvReK6H3zV2c7V9x281fBcMJPhLmmY7truQr-wuSuTG9WCVmzqCRYLEhUtFRfBrtqFUdoDzHv6zfIKgKjkKVyclmVkyiomS48MNbV9l6QJs7c6NKlor0q30zifpA03jbL_oYPd7wZ0UapwlJHGJSqS2uVLLVIeY1WH8qfn-EzgmsvLxCXk-eGQ)
Ôªø Ôªø
![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/YJdXwrzllWVk8mRC22GeBSaeSX4rni5MLttesJodjzv74VGN2qF0CLoPaJPYPwYfXRJ8NcheOcsOGWhSWltXP5nr5kUI6-DoCE4VnlrFZj4cDhFDNGo2rmwhtYrN1TWDAQbk5PrjzD0hbinkcGqQ-cNCo80m2IbB8EHFh9jYS5ye25I7flEtY_ycAg)
Ôªø

### CATEGORICAL DATA vs. NUMERIC DATA

The model does not understand ‚Äúconcepts‚Äù or ‚Äúcategories‚Äù.

- The model reduces the world to numbers.¬† (even categories get converted to numbers)

- Some Data models support ORDERED columns // many do not.

- Some columns are discrete (bucketed) others are not.

- Some columns have boundaries or exist on a scale (temperature, percentage) others do not (sales price, distance)

Generate one Forecast Tile for each categorical variable combination (ex. Stores and items)
You MUST GROUP BY | Ôªø
![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/M_JEhZr-ZOn4CiLlvDfelsFV0sMHw0VvBB-EpmraE-KktFkEmcJvungcIwtIAF1UXn8F0EmYBEqf4RSts20XZCXThJr9rdWQ0kxfiBYo0jZQDzw6Ul0bL9TAcWhbwBTuHxos76hfFOumuKOnrTH6ve8dKrmaed4wgvqO1dRNbx74S6wY-WArfi8jWw)
Ôªø

## Increase the Accountability of your Forecast Model

1. Use multiple flows (Offset = 7, 14 or 21) to capture the historical forecast
Ôªø
![](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/BrME0sF2hyuqpvt4oHO59fwVUN2zsT3AQtKhh6yMTItln4wusHHl43AVaQQu-FZ7kg_6Ine2RBoefLhwStP0d0JMc0B0GjDldVo3kYHGB4muCqN44rTn6YqKEPTaBdrAUSNnJUSi7Mlbmk53jL0yAyIwtjb_JQXs9Ma1_D3L998aMQd7KP3u0M5QwQ)
Ôªø
2. JOIN actuals onto the predictions so you can calculate absolute error or a cost equation to ascertain "how bad" your prediction was.

3. Consider comparing previous forecasts (with the WINDOW function) | Ôªø

[

](#remove-attachment)

[](#left)
[](#full_width)

![](https://datacrew.circle.so/rails/active_storage/representations/redirect/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBNzY0YXc9PSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoiYmxvYl9pZCJ9fQ==--2202cfba92b6f85992bdc2396245119e39bb83c3/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdDRG9MWm05eWJXRjBTU0lJVUU1SEJqb0dSVlE2RkhKbGMybDZaVjkwYjE5c2FXMXBkRnNIYVFJNEJEQTZDbk5oZG1WeWV3WTZDbk4wY21sd1ZBPT0iLCJleHAiOm51bGwsInB1ciI6InZhcmlhdGlvbiJ9fQ==--2ed767da9d356849cc629c62190b1d347052fee7/Capture.PNG)
Ôªø
GOOD LUCK!
I've covered some best practices before in this video
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lhj9zcwai98](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lhj9zcwai98)

And actually have an entire channel about Data Science
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_UGd0Ug9D5M&list=PLUy_qbtzH0S6HKLlz_MG_gRH2VKhi36sW](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_UGd0Ug9D5M&list=PLUy_qbtzH0S6HKLlz_MG_gRH2VKhi36sW)

Questions?¬† Join the Domo Slack Community
[https://join.slack.com/t/domousergroup/shared_invite/zt-1fo623tm8-dUAf6Aq6vNOG1ad79BueyA](https://join.slack.com/t/domousergroup/shared_invite/zt-1fo623tm8-dUAf6Aq6vNOG1ad79BueyA)

Want to view the ETL? Jump into the Domo-Dojo sandbox
[https://domo-dojo.domo.com/datacenter/dataflows/102/graph](https://domo-dojo.domo.com/datacenter/dataflows/102/graph)

Generate one Forecast Tile for each categorical variable combination (ex. Stores and items)
You MUST GROUP BY | Ôªø Ôªø

Increase the Accountability of your Forecast Model


1. Use multiple flows (Offset = 7, 14 or 21) to capture the historical forecast
 Ôªø Ôªø
2. JOIN actuals onto the predictions so you can calculate absolute error or a cost equation to ascertain "how bad" your prediction was.

3. Consider comparing previous forecasts (with the WINDOW function) | ÔªøÔªø
GOOD LUCK!
I've covered some best practices before in this video
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lhj9zcwai98

And actually have an entire channel about Data Science
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_UGd0Ug9D5M&list=PLUy_qbtzH0S6HKLlz_MG_gRH2VKhi36sW

Questions?  Join the Domo Slack Community
https://join.slack.com/t/domousergroup/shared_invite/zt-1fo623tm8-dUAf6Aq6vNOG1ad79BueyA

Want to view the ETL? Jump into the Domo-Dojo sandbox
https://domo-dojo.domo.com/datacenter/dataflows/102/graph

title: Data lineage for all datasets in one using #Python, #Magic ETL
author: Oleksii
content_markdown:
Data Governance with Domo is one of the key points of Data platform lifecycle.
I would like to share with you this video. It explains how to build the ETL flow based on Domo Governance connectors and produce data lineage for all datasets in your instance.
That data lineage can be used for Project health monitoring, identify which connector/dataset may impact your final data table.
Ôªø

ÔªøAnd here is the code presented in the video

# Import the domomagic package into the script
from domomagic import *
import pandas as pd

# read data from inputs into a data frame
df_input = read_dataframe('Datasets')
df_dataflow_details = read_dataframe('Dataflow details')

def append_row(df, row):
return pd.concat([
df,
pd.DataFrame([row], columns=row.index)]
).reset_index(drop=True)

df_result = pd.DataFrame(columns=('Leaf_Dataset_ID','Output_Dataset_ID', 'Parent_Dataflow_ID', 'Input_Dataset_IDs'))

def get_lineage (leaf_dataset, dataset, df):

dataflow_id=None
global df_result

if df[(df['Output Dataset ID'] == dataset)].shape[0] >0:
dataflow_id = df[(df['Output Dataset ID'] == dataset)]['Dataflow ID'].values[0]
#get inputs for the dataflow id
df_inputs =df[(df['Dataflow ID'] == dataflow_id)&(df['Input Dataset ID'].notnull())]
#input from column to string separated by commas
str_inputs = ','.join(df_inputs['Input Dataset ID'])

new_row = pd.Series({'Leaf_Dataset_ID':leaf_dataset,
'Output_Dataset_ID':dataset,
'Parent_Dataflow_ID':dataflow_id,
'Input_Dataset_IDs':str_inputs})
#add the row to result dataframe
df_result = append_row(df_result, new_row)

if dataflow_id is None:
return;
for index, row in df_inputs.iterrows():
#to avoid recursive flow and infinite loop
if dataset not in row['Input Dataset ID']:
get_lineage(leaf_dataset, row['Input Dataset ID'],df)
return

for index, row in df_input.iterrows():
get_lineage(row['Dataset ID'], row['Dataset ID'], df_dataflow_details)

df_result=df_result.drop_duplicates(keep='first').reset_index(drop=True)

# write a data frame so it's available to the next action
write_dataframe(df_result)

[#ISolvedItWithDomo](https://www.youtube.com/hashtag/isolveditwithdomo)
[#Domo](https://www.youtube.com/hashtag/domo)
[#DomoCommunity](https://www.youtube.com/hashtag/domocommunity)
[#BISensei](https://www.youtube.com/hashtag/bisensei)

Watch this and other videos on my Youtube channel [@BISensei](https://www.youtube.com/@bisensei)
content_html:
Data Governance with Domo is one of the key points of Data platform lifecycle.
I would like to share with you this video. It explains how to build the ETL flow based on Domo Governance connectors and produce data lineage for all datasets in your instance.
That data lineage can be used for Project health monitoring, identify which connector/dataset may impact your final data table.
Ôªø
ÔªøAnd here is the code presented in the video

# Import the domomagic package into the script 
from domomagic import *
import pandas as pd

# read data from inputs into a data frame
df_input = read_dataframe('Datasets')
df_dataflow_details = read_dataframe('Dataflow details')

def append_row(df, row):
    return pd.concat([
                df, 
                pd.DataFrame([row], columns=row.index)]
           ).reset_index(drop=True)


df_result = pd.DataFrame(columns=('Leaf_Dataset_ID','Output_Dataset_ID', 'Parent_Dataflow_ID', 'Input_Dataset_IDs'))

def get_lineage (leaf_dataset, dataset, df):
    
    dataflow_id=None
    global df_result
    
    if df[(df['Output Dataset ID'] == dataset)].shape[0] >0:
        dataflow_id = df[(df['Output Dataset ID'] == dataset)]['Dataflow ID'].values[0]
    #get inputs for the dataflow id
    df_inputs =df[(df['Dataflow ID'] == dataflow_id)&(df['Input Dataset ID'].notnull())]
    #input from column to string separated by commas
    str_inputs = ','.join(df_inputs['Input Dataset ID'])

    new_row = pd.Series({'Leaf_Dataset_ID':leaf_dataset,
                         'Output_Dataset_ID':dataset,
                         'Parent_Dataflow_ID':dataflow_id,
                         'Input_Dataset_IDs':str_inputs})
    #add the row to result dataframe
    df_result = append_row(df_result, new_row)
    
    if dataflow_id is None:
        return;
    for index, row in df_inputs.iterrows():
    #to avoid recursive flow and infinite loop
        if dataset not in row['Input Dataset ID']:
            get_lineage(leaf_dataset, row['Input Dataset ID'],df)
    return

for index, row in df_input.iterrows():
    get_lineage(row['Dataset ID'], row['Dataset ID'], df_dataflow_details)

df_result=df_result.drop_duplicates(keep='first').reset_index(drop=True)


# write a data frame so it's available to the next action
write_dataframe(df_result)

title: [Webinar Recording] - On DDX Bricks with Noah Finberg & Elliott Leonard
author: Jae Myong Wilson
content_markdown:
üéâThank you to everyone who attended.¬† This webinar was hosted on 11/2/2022 by the DataCrew team in an effort to bring more DDX Bricks awareness to the Domo Community.

Special thanks to Ôªø
[
Elliott Leonard
](https://datacrew.circle.so/u/3bc332af?show_back_link=true)

Ôªø and Ôªø
[
Noah Finberg
](https://datacrew.circle.so/u/06c29055?show_back_link=true)

Ôªø for their participation!¬† üéâ

Original Event Link - [https://datacrew.circle.so/c/events-170e7d/ddx-bricks-ama](https://datacrew.circle.so/c/events-170e7d/ddx-bricks-ama)

Ôªø

Ôªø

# Important Links

- [DDX Bricks KB¬†](https://developer.domo.com/docs/ddx-bricks/ddx-bricks-overview)

- üßµ Join the Domo User Group [Slack](https://domousergroup.carrd.co/)[ ](http://domousergroup.com/coc)Community

- How to Access the Domo-dojo instance ([Dojo link](https://dojo.domo.com/main/discussion/55204/access-to-domo-dojo-instance))

- Community DDX Dashboard ([domo-dojo link](https://domo-dojo.domo.com/page/1614788699))

- üé• Elliott‚Äôs [YouTube Channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZfU64hdkKvuOxtWLO0FxnQ)

- üé• DataCrew [YouTube Channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpnWmFCBWyqBMJlw6ZxNokQ)

# Q&A and Resources

## Reading Datasets into DDX Bricks

üé• [Webinar Link Demo 2](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15nXTopnRcI&t=704s)

### Use *Domo.get* to retrieve data from the APIs

[https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-guides/domo-js#domo.get](https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-guides/domo-js#domo.get)

This method works, but the SQL API might be easier to interpret/use

üíéPRO TIP.¬† Take the time to learn and understand ‚ÄúPromises‚Äù

Ôªø
![](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/4bOPmAieeiwjqReYcDYULD5Oo9H48eNFiUT205RkkMzgHWC0j0mx5Wwki7U3_Znnj6xwfwAoownruA9v1SUzPtkLNQ4HD9tIkw6beecu9NuYJAZ9Hf5-dhEHhWzLtoxuqvVlgfwBHkP7ujArkfK_zNOnQDGit4whCiGHT1Mex4u26n7qkx72S6z7QPzE)
Ôªø

This snippet says ‚Äúwait till you get a response from your 4 APIs THEN ‚Ä¶ do something.

Imagine you have a brick that consumes data extracted from 4 APIs.¬† When you send your *domo.get()* request, you don‚Äôt know how long it‚Äôll take your API to return a result.

Each .get() method returns a promise that eventually you‚Äôll get something back, but instead of blocking code execution (synchronous execution), JavaScript allows us to move to the next line of code and come back to the promise when it has a result (asynchronous code execution).

üíé¬† Where have you seen asynchronous code execution?

Have you ever visited a graphics heavy website with slow internet connection and seen a spinning loading icon while parts of the page finished loading?¬† Classic example of asynchronous code execution!

Alternatively, have you ever scrolled facebook and all the text loaded faster than the images?¬† Another example of a page requiring two different APIs AND asynchronous code execution.

[https://www.w3schools.com/js/js_promise.asp](https://www.w3schools.com/js/js_promise.asp)

### üíéThe SQL API is even easier than *Domo.get*

**¬†**[https://developer.domo.com/docs/dataset-api-reference/dataset#Query%20a%20DataSet](https://developer.domo.com/docs/dataset-api-reference/dataset#Query%20a%20DataSet)

When it comes to code you can execute in DDX bricks, it looks like you can only hit ‚Äúpublic APIs‚Äù i.e. APIs documented under [www.developer.domo.com](http://www.developer.domo.com)

On Private Vs. Public APIs

- Get Outa the Domo UI - Domo IDEAS Exchange Conference Video [YouTube video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hRwrZABP8RE)

**Are there limitations in the SQL API with queries?**

Balance what you execute as a query in the app vs. what you implement in ETL or a Dataset View.¬† The simpler the query, the faster the query response, and the snappier the app.

Theoretically, the SQL API is passing the same queries to the same database engine that resolves Dataset Views, so yes, theoretically subqueries should be supported in the SQL API‚Ä¶ should you do it? ‚Ä¶ different question.

**How to have more than one dataset in DDX bricks?**

Use the DDX 10 Datasets Brick ([domo-dojo link](https://domo-dojo.domo.com/domoapp/card/edit/1786828858?page=1614788699&details=true))

### Pulling Parameters from the Environment

üé• [Webinar Link Demo 1](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15nXTopnRcI&t=605s)

[https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-guides/domo-js#domo.env](https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-guides/domo-js#domo.env)

### Use a DDX Brick to apply a Page Filter

üé• [Webinar Link Demo 5](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15nXTopnRcI&t=1347s)

[https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-guides/domo-js#domo.filterContainer](https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-guides/domo-js#domo.filterContainer)

### Making your App react with Event Listeners and OnClick events

üé• [Webinar Link - Demo 6](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15nXTopnRcI&t=1425s)

[https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/html-button-onclick-javascript-click-event-tutorial/](https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/html-button-onclick-javascript-click-event-tutorial/)

[https://www.w3schools.com/howto/howto_js_trigger_button_enter.asp](https://www.w3schools.com/howto/howto_js_trigger_button_enter.asp)

### Using Phoenix Library

üé• [Webinar Link - Demo 4](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15nXTopnRcI&t=1138s)

[https://github.com/DomoApps/domo-phoenix](https://github.com/DomoApps/domo-phoenix)

[https://domoapps.github.io/domo-phoenix/#/domo-phoenix/properties](https://domoapps.github.io/domo-phoenix/#/domo-phoenix/properties)

The Phoenix library was implemented to provide a JavaScript charting library that looked and felt like Analyzer.

### Getting Started with State Management + AppDB

üé• [Webinar Link - Demo 6](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15nXTopnRcI&t=1425s)

[https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-references/appdb](https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-references/appdb)

AppDb can be used to store form data or user interactions (aka ‚Äústate management‚Äù)

üíé Where have you seen state management?

Any time you log into an app and it ‚Äòremembers‚Äô who you are or what was in your shopping cart.

[https://dev.to/abdurrkhalid333/what-is-state-management-and-why-you-should-learn-it-3kai](https://dev.to/abdurrkhalid333/what-is-state-management-and-why-you-should-learn-it-3kai)

## Additional Infrastructure and Development Skill

üé• [Webinar Link - Noah's Intro](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15nXTopnRcI&t=418s)

üé• [Webinar Link - the Value of an "App Platform"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15nXTopnRcI&t=1875s)

What do they mean, by ‚ÄúDomo makes it easier to build and deploy an app?‚Äù

[https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio/dev-studio-overview](https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio/dev-studio-overview)

## üíéDevelopment Pro Practices

### Use CodePen as a faster IDE (development environment)

üé• [Webinar Link - Tip 3 - use CodePen](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15nXTopnRcI&t=2339s)

[www.codepen.io](http://www.codepen.io)

CodePen has great (simple) code samples built by the larger javascript community.¬† Integrate the examples into your DDX Bricks.

To mimic the *handleResults*() function in CodePen (which is NOT hooked up to the Domo API): *console_log(data)* and then copy/paste the results into your CodePen Javascript file as a new variable, *data*.¬† This allows you to develop code in CodePen after the point data was retrieved dynamically from the Domo‚Äôs Dataset API.

### Inspect your Browser to see how your HTML document is shaped.

üé• [Webinar Link - Demo 1](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15nXTopnRcI&t=605s)

üé• [Webinar Link - Tip 4 - using the Browser to inspect the DOM (rendered HTML document)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15nXTopnRcI&t=2438s)

This can help you troubleshoot and debug how your app displays data in the browser.

Pro Tip.¬† Take the time to learn about DOM manipulation. (i.e. ‚ÄúDynamically adding content to your webpage‚Äù)

[https://fundamentals.generalassemb.ly/11_unit/dom-cheatsheet.html](https://fundamentals.generalassemb.ly/11_unit/dom-cheatsheet.html)

If you want your app to be pretty, but spend less time ‚Äúreinventing the wheel‚Äù learn about Bootstrap ([https://getbootstrap.com/](https://getbootstrap.com/))

If you‚Äôve heard of React ([https://reactjs.org/](https://reactjs.org/)) this library is designed to simplify DOM manipulation.

If you‚Äôre competent in React, consider learning about MUI (previously MaterialUI, [https://mui.com/](https://mui.com/) )

### Consider using Save As Copy for Version Control

DDX Bricks don‚Äôt really integrate with any of Domo‚Äôs built in Version Control (or at least not in a way we can quickly access.

If you are making major revisions to your App, consider Saving your app as a copy.¬† Just like you can save your cards and change the columns, or filters, you can save a copy of your card and modify the code.

Alternatively, as you start building more sophisticated projects, consider saving your documents in folders backed up using GitHub.

## Other Questions

**If the DDX brick is published to another instance, will it know to use the respective dataset within that subscriber not the publisher?**

Apps can be deployed with sample datasets (like all the apps you‚Äôre deploying) there is no built-in wiring that integrates with publish.¬† That‚Äôs relatively niche.¬† You could write a script that handles wiring up the datasets (like the Quickstarts do).¬† Keep in mind that an app deployed to a different instance will ultimately consume a dataset with a different dataset_id so it‚Äôs hard to ‚Äújust know‚Äù what the correct dataset is.

**is it always necessary to have a dataset even if it's not used?**

Each DDX Brick that YOU build is based on a baseline template (the app in the AppStore).¬† Those Templates have a fixed number of datasets available (in the blank app it has 3, in the 10 Dataset brick its 10)¬† Do you HAVE to use them? No.¬† But is there a max you can / could use?¬† Yes, as defined by the template.

**For Maps: Is it possible to go as granular a map based on postal codes for Germany?**

Are you talking about the standard apps in Analyzer?¬† It depends on what THAT chart type is capable of.

If you‚Äôre talking about a custom app built using SVGs that‚Äôs a different tool.¬† If you used a custom map, could you use a map that was divided by German postal codes?¬† Sure, if you can find that SVG.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eKOLhsfl10Q](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eKOLhsfl10Q)

If you want to use ArcGIS ([https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/)) or any other library, the answer is defined by the library you choose.

# Other Bricks of Interest

Filtering on multiple Columns (Ben Schein)

[https://www.domo.com/appstore/app/ddx-searchable-filter-app-multiple-columns/overview](https://www.domo.com/appstore/app/ddx-searchable-filter-app-multiple-columns/overview)

Example of Where used (this was initially a custom app and the code was migrated to a flexible DDX Brick for you! YAYYYY)

[https://www.domo.com/covid19/data-explorer/all/](https://www.domo.com/covid19/data-explorer/all/)

Theoretically, the SQL API is passing the same queries to the same database engine that resolves Dataset Views, so yes, theoretically subqueries should be supported in the SQL API‚Ä¶ should you do it? ‚Ä¶ different question.

How to have more than one dataset in DDX bricks?
Use the DDX 10 Datasets Brick (domo-dojo link)

Pulling Parameters from the Environment

üé• Webinar Link Demo 1 

https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-guides/domo-js#domo.env 

Use a DDX Brick to apply a Page Filter

üé• Webinar Link Demo 5 
https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-guides/domo-js#domo.filterContainer

Making your App react with Event Listeners and OnClick events

üé• Webinar Link - Demo 6
https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/html-button-onclick-javascript-click-event-tutorial/
https://www.w3schools.com/howto/howto_js_trigger_button_enter.asp

Using Phoenix Library

üé• Webinar Link - Demo 4 
https://github.com/DomoApps/domo-phoenix
https://domoapps.github.io/domo-phoenix/#/domo-phoenix/properties

The Phoenix library was implemented to provide a JavaScript charting library that looked and felt like Analyzer.   

Getting Started with State Management + AppDB

üé• Webinar Link - Demo 6
https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-references/appdb

AppDb can be used to store form data or user interactions (aka ‚Äústate management‚Äù)

üíé Where have you seen state management?
Any time you log into an app and it ‚Äòremembers‚Äô who you are or what was in your shopping cart.
https://dev.to/abdurrkhalid333/what-is-state-management-and-why-you-should-learn-it-3kai

Additional Infrastructure and Development Skill

üé• Webinar Link - Noah's Intro 
üé• Webinar Link - the Value of an "App Platform" 

What do they mean, by ‚ÄúDomo makes it easier to build and deploy an app?‚Äù
https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio/dev-studio-overview 

üíéDevelopment Pro Practices

Use CodePen as a faster IDE (development environment)

üé• Webinar Link - Tip 3 - use CodePen
www.codepen.io

CodePen has great (simple) code samples built by the larger javascript community.  Integrate the examples into your DDX Bricks.

To mimic the handleResults() function in CodePen (which is NOT hooked up to the Domo API): console_log(data) and then copy/paste the results into your CodePen Javascript file as a new variable, data.  This allows you to develop code in CodePen after the point data was retrieved dynamically from the Domo‚Äôs Dataset API.

Inspect your Browser to see how your HTML document is shaped.

üé• Webinar Link - Demo 1 
üé• Webinar Link - Tip 4 - using the Browser to inspect the DOM (rendered HTML document)
This can help you troubleshoot and debug how your app displays data in the browser.

Pro Tip.  Take the time to learn about DOM manipulation. (i.e. ‚ÄúDynamically adding content to your webpage‚Äù)
https://fundamentals.generalassemb.ly/11_unit/dom-cheatsheet.html

If you want your app to be pretty, but spend less time ‚Äúreinventing the wheel‚Äù learn about Bootstrap (https://getbootstrap.com/)

If you‚Äôve heard of React (https://reactjs.org/) this library is designed to simplify DOM manipulation.

If you‚Äôre competent in React, consider learning about MUI (previously MaterialUI, https://mui.com/ )

Consider using Save As Copy for Version Control

DDX Bricks don‚Äôt really integrate with any of Domo‚Äôs built in Version Control (or at least not in a way we can quickly access.

If you are making major revisions to your App, consider Saving your app as a copy.  Just like you can save your cards and change the columns, or filters, you can save a copy of your card and modify the code.  

Alternatively, as you start building more sophisticated projects, consider saving your documents in folders backed up using GitHub.

Other Questions

If the DDX brick is published to another instance, will it know to use the respective dataset within that subscriber not the publisher?
Apps can be deployed with sample datasets (like all the apps you‚Äôre deploying) there is no built-in wiring that integrates with publish.  That‚Äôs relatively niche.  You could write a script that handles wiring up the datasets (like the Quickstarts do).  Keep in mind that an app deployed to a different instance will ultimately consume a dataset with a different dataset_id so it‚Äôs hard to ‚Äújust know‚Äù what the correct dataset is.

is it always necessary to have a dataset even if it's not used?
Each DDX Brick that YOU build is based on a baseline template (the app in the AppStore).  Those Templates have a fixed number of datasets available (in the blank app it has 3, in the 10 Dataset brick its 10)  Do you HAVE to use them? No.  But is there a max you can / could use?  Yes, as defined by the template.

For Maps: Is it possible to go as granular a map based on postal codes for Germany?
Are you talking about the standard apps in Analyzer?  It depends on what THAT chart type is capable of.

If you‚Äôre talking about a custom app built using SVGs that‚Äôs a different tool.  If you used a custom map, could you use a map that was divided by German postal codes?  Sure, if you can find that SVG.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eKOLhsfl10Q

If you want to use ArcGIS (https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/) or any other library, the answer is defined by the library you choose.

Other Bricks of Interest

Filtering on multiple Columns (Ben Schein)
https://www.domo.com/appstore/app/ddx-searchable-filter-app-multiple-columns/overview

Example of Where used (this was initially a custom app and the code was migrated to a flexible DDX Brick for you! YAYYYY)
https://www.domo.com/covid19/data-explorer/all/

title: Beware of the Swiss Army Report
author: Bryan Van Kampen
content_markdown:
When my fianc√© visited Switzerland to finish her MBA she brought me back a Swiss Army knife. This knife stays in my bag and I use it all the time to open amazon packages, quickly unscrew things or open bottles. While I love the versatility of such a tool, it doesn‚Äôt actually *excel* at any of these tasks. Assembling furniture is easier with a screwdriver and you‚Äôll never see a bartender on a busy night opening bottles with a multitool.

The same can be said for building effective Business Intelligence (BI) charts. Many new report builders tend to jam a single chart full of information, especially when given a new BI tool to play with. *‚ÄúLook! This chart shows X, Y, Z and the colors show A, B, C!‚Äù *And while that chart may show those all of these things, it doesn‚Äôt do them well.

A good chart will tell you a story and help guide business decisions. It will be clear and concise and the reader should be able to immediately gleam what the chart is showing you with a quick glance. The longer you look it should provide additional insights to the overall narrative but not provide unrelated or unnecessary information.

**Tips for avoiding a Swiss Army Chart:
**

- Use the [appropriate chart type](https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/types-of-graphs-for-data-visualization) for the data you are trying to show.

- Make your chart answer one business question at a time.

- Provide a thoughtful summary that includes the business question.

- Drill-downs should provide more specificity to the answer and help answer the overall question.

- Label the axes so the reader is immediately aware of what they are looking at.

Follow these tips to start building screwdrivers and bottle openers and keep the multi-tool in your bag!

Assembling furniture is easier with a screwdriver and you‚Äôll never see a bartender on a busy night opening bottles with a multitool.

The same can be said for building effective Business Intelligence (BI) charts. Many new report builders tend to jam a single chart full of information, especially when given a new BI tool to play with. ‚ÄúLook! This chart shows X, Y, Z and the colors show A, B, C!‚Äù And while that chart may show those all of these things, it doesn‚Äôt do them well.

Follow these tips to start building screwdrivers and bottle openers and keep the multi-tool in your bag!

title: Living your best Data life (Lessons Learned from Roller Coaster Tycoon)
author: Bryan Van Kampen
content_markdown:
Growing up I loved playing Roller Coaster Tycoon. I'd pop the Age of Empires II out of the drive, slip in the shiny Roller Coaster Tycoon CD and suddenly I'm Walt Disney. Then I relied on *feelings and observations *to guide my park-running decisions. I'd see a long queue line and see that Go-Karts is popular and decide to build another. I'd feel like my guests wanted a bathroom in a certain spot (I made drinks free and bathrooms cost $15) and drop one there. I'd see that *Alan S* is lost and personally intervene by picking him up and dropping him back on the path.

I picked up this game as an adult on for my iPad and my approach is entirely different. As a kid, I didn't even know I could open up the "Thoughts" tab or see exactly how a stall or ride is doing. I'm constantly opening up the financials for each stand or ride, playing with the prices, trying to figure out supply and demand for a certain item or ride. As I started to consume this data, I immediately wanted a better way to organize and slice and dice it. I wanted to be able to track price and sales over time and drill down to the lowest granularity. I wanted more data. Yes, now I know that "Information Kiosk 4" is my highest selling kiosk but is that because of the location? The prices? The umbrella colors?

Companies that aren't data-driven and not [managing by exception](https://www.domo.com/product/alert-center) are doing the exact same thing as 10-year-old Bryan (although hopefully, not charging $15 dollars for bathrooms). They will be reactive to problems, driving their company entirely by feel and observations and building a second go-cart track instead of raising the prices. They're putting out fires that should have been settled 3 weeks ago. They're reporting off of stale data, lost customers and broken-down rides.

Data-driven companies are the adult Bryan. They're using data in real-time to make decisions, getting alerts that people are getting confused and fixing the sidewalks before *Alan S *even complains. They're tracking trends and getting alerts on their phones when things fall out of exceptions. They're not getting 10-page reports listing all sales, they're getting an alert when Information Kiosk 4 is having an incredible year and can drill down immediately and see why.

Who are you? Are you out there building more go-carts or actually using data to drive your business forward?

title: Master Class - Data Governance & Activity Log
author: Jae Myong Wilson
content_markdown:
Each session starts at 10AM MST and runs 1.5 hours.

[Register Here](https://lu.ma/chii7rhh)

**June 23: Activity Log & People QuickStart Revisited**

Use the Domo QuickStarts as foundations for measuring and monitoring user engagement, then redevelop the dashboards to track assets and re-implement the dashboard using metrics that capture user engagement as well as trend asset lifecycles.

- Define your Domo Content Lifecycle.

- Deploy the Activity Log Quickstart.

- Customize Quickstart according to your content lifecycle

**June 24: Domo Governance & Instance Health**

Use the Domo Governance Datasets for tracking aging and underutilized assets. Develop workflows for scoring data quality or data profiling. Use the CLI to automate instance cleanup.

- Ensure data quality by building data profiling datasets and monitor fluctuations over time

- Automate tracking, monitoring; and archiving aging assets

**June 30: Certification Workflows and PDP Automation**

Implement Certification workflows and explore PDP Automation pipelines

- Define your content certification strategy

- Extend your content monitoring dashboards to include certification

- Create dashboards to facilitate certification workflows and periodic auditing.

title: Fall 2022 (Oct 20) Domo Release
author: Jae Myong Wilson
content_markdown:
**Courtesy of my Support Technician
**
If you would like to view the below summaries on our new feature website, please visit [https://www.domo.com/product/new-features#/](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.domo.com/product/new-features*/__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy3-DtGf0w%24)¬† and under filter-by, please click the dropdown and select October 2022 from the options.

**Current Release Notes: **¬†[https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360042936114-Current-Release-Notes
](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360042936114-Current-Release-Notes__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy03KLP9cQ%24)

[**Custom Password Blocklist**](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.domo.com/product/new-features*custom-password-blocklist__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy2JzL70GQ%24)**: **Domo admins can now create a list of passwords that cannot be used within their Domo instance. With this tool, admins can limit or prevent unauthorized access following data or credential leaks, keeping data secure. The password blocklist can also help protect data by blocking passwords used in demo and testing environments from gaining access to production environments.[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360042934474-Setting-Password-Requirements

](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360042934474-Setting-Password-Requirements__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy1yRvqwqA%24)[**Variables in Analyzer and Dashboards**](https://www.domo.com/product/new-features#variables)**:**¬† Variables is an exciting package of features that allow users to level up simple dashboards to interactive data apps. With Variables, users create dynamic metrics that can be used in Beast Modes, cards, and dashboards. No coding required.

Now, data analysts can build simple data apps that enable business users to answer their own questions by adjusting dimensions and metrics themselves. Variables means powerful self-serve analytics, resulting in faster insights and less friction between business and data teams.

Variables has a variety of exciting self-serve applications, including:

- What-if-analysis capabilities ‚Äì ex: mortgage rates, inventory forecasts, margin impact

- Dynamic analytical views ‚Äì switch out dimension or metric columns in your chart ‚Äã

- Time comparison analysis ‚Äì create sophisticated period-over-period visualization analysis‚Äã

- Guided analysis ‚Äì each user can modify control inputs and visualization updates with user selection

Check out the [product overview video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G4Gu86HyiYE&list=PLUy_qbtzH0S6f3df0W-FSDAArHIWBAkx8) to learn more.

[
](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360042934474-Setting-Password-Requirements__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy1yRvqwqA%24) [Variables Demo Dashboard](https://domo-dojo.domo.com/page/1880852133) in the Domo Dojo Community instance.
[Community Presentation of Variables](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yzZEagCJ4Gc&list=PLUy_qbtzH0S6f3df0W-FSDAArHIWBAkx8&index=2) Video[
](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360042934474-Setting-Password-Requirements__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy1yRvqwqA%24)

[**Administrative Interface for AppDB**](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.domo.com/product/new-features*administrative-interface-for-appdb__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy3WscmWkg%24)**: **Customers now have access to an admin interface for AppDB. Previously, many tasks related to collections ‚Äì querying data, creating collections, updating permissions, and more ‚Äì had to be managed through API calls. With this new interface, users can save time and manage all of these tasks in one place.[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9221297758615-AppDB-Admin-User-Interface
](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9221297758615-AppDB-Admin-User-Interface__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy1x18jylQ%24)

[**Interactive Mobile Dashboards**](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.domo.com/product/new-features*interactive-mobile-dashboards__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy3euJEQTQ%24)**: **With this enhancement, users accessing Domo via mobile will easily be able to interact with charts and apply and clear filters with a single tap. They can also drill deeper into data on their mobile devices and interact with apps at a dashboard level. [https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/1500010172542-Editing-a-Dashboard-s-Mobile-Layout
](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/1500010172542-Editing-a-Dashboard-s-Mobile-Layout__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy2lYui0Dg%24)

[**Story Presentation Mode**](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.domo.com/product/new-features*story-presentation-mode__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy2P6BQLpg%24)**: **With Presentation mode, Stories can be an even more valuable presentation tool. Users can now quickly expand visualizations to see charts more clearly, zoom in to see specific portions of data-dense tables, and more. [https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9355841270167
](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9355841270167__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy38pA0pjw%24)

[**Dark Mode for Mobile:**](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.domo.com/product/new-features*dark-mode-for-mobile__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy0_cknsdQ%24)** **Users accessing Domo via mobile device will now see their experience match their phone‚Äôs settings related to Dark Mode, making cards and dashboards easier to read regardless of time of day or lighting environment. (Does this mean that dark mode is available for the web? No)

[**Workbench Support for Duplicate Job Templates:**](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.domo.com/product/new-features*workbench-support-for-duplicate-job-templates__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy21otYEsg%24)** **Domo customers using Workbench to generate datasets often want to run multiple similar jobs or create multiple similar datasets from the same database, only changing a few details about the query. Workbench now supports duplication of job templates, making it significantly easier to create multiple jobs at scale, saving time and manual effort.[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9338871306135-Duplicating-a-Job-in-Workbench-5-2
](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9338871306135-Duplicating-a-Job-in-Workbench-5-2__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy2lWXhuLA%24)

[**Domo Everywhere Enhancements**](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.domo.com/product/new-features*domo-everywhere-enhancements__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy1ByFFftw%24)**:**

-
**Simplified Admin Experience ‚Äì **Domo Everywhere and Brand Kit admin now falls under the main Admin page within Domo, making it easier for Domo Everywhere admins to change settings, update subscriber lists, and control look and feel all in one place.

-
**Saved filter views **‚Äì Before publishing content with Domo Everywhere, Domo customers can now build and save filters to ensure that data is shared with their external audiences exactly as they want it to be. This will help reduce the burden on the end user to see the data they‚Äôre looking for and provides Domo customers with a level of control before publishing.[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/4418999855639-Filter-Options-for-the-Embedded-View-Experience](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/4418999855639-Filter-Options-for-the-Embedded-View-Experience__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy2mjr0WWQ%24)

-
**Whole Page Filtering **‚Äì With whole page filtering, end users can still filter data across multiple individual cards, creating the experience of a cohesive dashboard while maintaining that controlled content output Domo customers want.[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360043437993-Sharing-Content-Outside-of-Domo-with-Embed#h_01GFNH58Q069B2TVP43TMRV886](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360043437993-Sharing-Content-Outside-of-Domo-with-Embed*h_01GFNH58Q069B2TVP43TMRV886__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy12FTT5WQ%24)

-
**Authorized Domains** ‚Äì Domo Everywhere admins can ensure that embedded content stays in its intended locations by adding approved domains to the Authorized Domains list. Any content embedded outside of these domains will simply fail to render, keeping that content secure.[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360043437993-Sharing-Content-Outside-of-Domo-with-Embed#h_01GFNH58Q069B2TVP43TMRV886](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360043437993-Sharing-Content-Outside-of-Domo-with-Embed*h_01GFNH58Q069B2TVP43TMRV886__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy12FTT5WQ%24)

-
**Publish Dynamic PDP ‚Äì **Customers publishing content to multiple subscribers can now filter that content at the publish level, using PDP-like controls to ensure that subscribers only see data and content relevant to them. This will save Domo customers time and manual effort by consolidating maintenance of publication jobs pulling from the same datasets.[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045120554-Publishing-Content-to-a-Subscriber-Organization#3.0.8](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045120554-Publishing-Content-to-a-Subscriber-Organization*3.0.8__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy2_T4cT-Q%24).

-
**Dataset Switching ‚Äì **With dataset switching, Domo customers no longer need to create custom cards or dataset for each separate data viewer or customer account, and can instead choose what dataset powers a given visualization at the time it is displayed. This cuts down on money and time spent administering the embedded environment while also reinforcing the security measures that prevent the wrong data being displayed to the wrong viewer.

-
**Auto-Subscribe ‚Äì **Domo Everywhere now allows end subscribers (the customers and partners of Domo customers) to automate all tasks required to establish trust between the subscriber and the publishers they expect to receive content from.[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/6523741250455-Domo-Everywhere-Routing-Creation-and-Mapping](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/6523741250455-Domo-Everywhere-Routing-Creation-and-Mapping__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy10l3P4hQ%24)

-
**Default Sharing Rules ‚Äì **Often, Domo customers use Domo Everywhere to monetize their data as they share it with *their* customers and external partners. With this new capability, subscribers to a published Domo Everywhere environment (e.g. the customers of Domo customers) can now automate the process by which they accept published data and share it out within their organizations.

-
**Dashboard Embed Exports** ‚Äì End users can now export embedded dashboards as a PDF or PowerPoint, including all filters applied and the layout of the dashboard. This will be especially helpful for those utilizing scheduled reports, as they can now export and send the entire dashboard to their audience, rather than creating scheduled reports for individual cards.[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/4492108625687-Exporting-Embedded-Content
](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/4492108625687-Exporting-Embedded-Content__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy2Efas4cg%24)

[**Governance Toolkit Enhancements**](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.domo.com/product/new-features*governance-toolkit-enhancements__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy0si-y2GA%24)**:¬†**

-
**Observability Metrics ‚Äì **With Observability Metrics, customers can pull any and all DomoStats reports across multiple instances into one primary instance, saving time and effort. Additionally, a Domo Access Token Account can be used to assign one common Username/Password combination to pull DomoStats reports from all of their Domo instances.[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/8275510785559-Governance-Toolkit-Observability-Metrics](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/8275510785559-Governance-Toolkit-Observability-Metrics__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy2N90Z1Ew%24)

-
**Triggered reports - **Customers can now schedule reports to trigger on a Dataset update or alert trigger, offering more insight and governance on scheduled reports.[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9301034807575-Governance-Toolkit-Triggered-Reports](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9301034807575-Governance-Toolkit-Triggered-Reports__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy1-tdD2Zg%24)

[**Sandbox enhancements**](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.domo.com/product/new-features*sandbox-enhancements__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy0S99fVQA%24)**:**[**¬†**https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/4403367344023-Domo-Sandbox](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/4403367344023-Domo-Sandbox__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy2luT44KQ%24)

-
**Connector support ‚Äì **Customers who have a connector in their development instance can now transport connectors to test and production instances via Sandbox. This allows them to transport the configuration of that connector across instances, meaning they can now use that connector in different ways for different stages of development.

-
**Link mapping **‚Äì Sandbox now allows a user to give a mapping for items in their repository that otherwise wouldn‚Äôt have a clear link. If a user has a page that points to another page that is not in the repository, Sandbox will give the user an opportunity to map the appropriate link during the promotion process.

-
**Heuristic content mapping **‚Äì Customers using datasets with key similarities (including name, schema type, and others) will now be able to automate the mapping process across instances using Sandbox. This will be a huge time saver, especially for customers using a common naming convention across instances.

[**
Jupyter Notebooks Enhancements:**](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/www.domo.com/product/new-features*jupyter-notebooks-enhancements__;Iw!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy08PBt5ug%24)[ https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360047400753-Jupyter-Workspaces](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360047400753-Jupyter-Workspaces__;!!JmoZiZGBv3RvKRSx!8lh6In14h7mS5Kc3jwNsVAT9NgtsEhGtoPMpkjGsbrQR_bPhx3wF799mtRtJ2zk-GAYbA4YIcdMRUXzPfYhnFy19uBbP5g%24)

-
**Support for Domo Credentials - **Customers using Jupyter Workspaces can now reference Domo credentials directly, providing greater security than raw credentials from notebooks.**¬†**

-
**Workspace sharing - **Jupyter administrators can now enable sharing on Workspaces. With sharing enabled, administrators and owners can now allow different users to edit and run a Workspace by adding them to it, increasing collaboration while maintaining admin control over resources.

Courtesy of my Support Technician

If you would like to view the below summaries on our new feature website, please visit https://www.domo.com/product/new-features#/  and under filter-by, please click the dropdown and select October 2022 from the options.

Current Release Notes:  https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360042936114-Current-Release-Notes

Custom Password Blocklist: Domo admins can now create a list of passwords that cannot be used within their Domo instance. With this tool, admins can limit or prevent unauthorized access following data or credential leaks, keeping data secure. The password blocklist can also help protect data by blocking passwords used in demo and testing environments from gaining access to production environments. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360042934474-Setting-Password-Requirements

Variables in Analyzer and Dashboards:  Variables is an exciting package of features that allow users to level up simple dashboards to interactive data apps. With Variables, users create dynamic metrics that can be used in Beast Modes, cards, and dashboards. No coding required.

Now, data analysts can build simple data apps that enable business users to answer their own questions by adjusting dimensions and metrics themselves. Variables means powerful self-serve analytics, resulting in faster insights and less friction between business and data teams.

Variables has a variety of exciting self-serve applications, including:
  • What-if-analysis capabilities ‚Äì ex: mortgage rates, inventory forecasts, margin impact
  • Dynamic analytical views ‚Äì switch out dimension or metric columns in your chart ‚Äã
  • Time comparison analysis ‚Äì create sophisticated period-over-period visualization analysis‚Äã
  • Guided analysis ‚Äì each user can modify control inputs and visualization updates with user selection

Check out the product overview video to learn more. 

 Variables Demo Dashboard in the Domo Dojo Community instance.
Community Presentation of Variables Video

Administrative Interface for AppDB: Customers now have access to an admin interface for AppDB. Previously, many tasks related to collections ‚Äì querying data, creating collections, updating permissions, and more ‚Äì had to be managed through API calls. With this new interface, users can save time and manage all of these tasks in one place. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9221297758615-AppDB-Admin-User-Interface

Interactive Mobile Dashboards: With this enhancement, users accessing Domo via mobile will easily be able to interact with charts and apply and clear filters with a single tap. They can also drill deeper into data on their mobile devices and interact with apps at a dashboard level. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/1500010172542-Editing-a-Dashboard-s-Mobile-Layout

Story Presentation Mode: With Presentation mode, Stories can be an even more valuable presentation tool. Users can now quickly expand visualizations to see charts more clearly, zoom in to see specific portions of data-dense tables, and more. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9355841270167

Dark Mode for Mobile: Users accessing Domo via mobile device will now see their experience match their phone‚Äôs settings related to Dark Mode, making cards and dashboards easier to read regardless of time of day or lighting environment. (Does this mean that dark mode is available for the web? No)

Workbench Support for Duplicate Job Templates: Domo customers using Workbench to generate datasets often want to run multiple similar jobs or create multiple similar datasets from the same database, only changing a few details about the query. Workbench now supports duplication of job templates, making it significantly easier to create multiple jobs at scale, saving time and manual effort. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9338871306135-Duplicating-a-Job-in-Workbench-5-2

Domo Everywhere Enhancements:
  • Simplified Admin Experience ‚Äì Domo Everywhere and Brand Kit admin now falls under the main Admin page within Domo, making it easier for Domo Everywhere admins to change settings, update subscriber lists, and control look and feel all in one place.
  • Saved filter views ‚Äì Before publishing content with Domo Everywhere, Domo customers can now build and save filters to ensure that data is shared with their external audiences exactly as they want it to be. This will help reduce the burden on the end user to see the data they‚Äôre looking for and provides Domo customers with a level of control before publishing. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/4418999855639-Filter-Options-for-the-Embedded-View-Experience
  • Whole Page Filtering ‚Äì With whole page filtering, end users can still filter data across multiple individual cards, creating the experience of a cohesive dashboard while maintaining that controlled content output Domo customers want. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360043437993-Sharing-Content-Outside-of-Domo-with-Embed#h_01GFNH58Q069B2TVP43TMRV886
  • Authorized Domains ‚Äì Domo Everywhere admins can ensure that embedded content stays in its intended locations by adding approved domains to the Authorized Domains list. Any content embedded outside of these domains will simply fail to render, keeping that content secure. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360043437993-Sharing-Content-Outside-of-Domo-with-Embed#h_01GFNH58Q069B2TVP43TMRV886  
  • Publish Dynamic PDP ‚Äì Customers publishing content to multiple subscribers can now filter that content at the publish level, using PDP-like controls to ensure that subscribers only see data and content relevant to them. This will save Domo customers time and manual effort by consolidating maintenance of publication jobs pulling from the same datasets. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360045120554-Publishing-Content-to-a-Subscriber-Organization#3.0.8.
  • Dataset Switching ‚Äì With dataset switching, Domo customers no longer need to create custom cards or dataset for each separate data viewer or customer account, and can instead choose what dataset powers a given visualization at the time it is displayed. This cuts down on money and time spent administering the embedded environment while also reinforcing the security measures that prevent the wrong data being displayed to the wrong viewer.
  • Auto-Subscribe ‚Äì Domo Everywhere now allows end subscribers (the customers and partners of Domo customers) to automate all tasks required to establish trust between the subscriber and the publishers they expect to receive content from. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/6523741250455-Domo-Everywhere-Routing-Creation-and-Mapping
  • Default Sharing Rules ‚Äì Often, Domo customers use Domo Everywhere to monetize their data as they share it with their customers and external partners. With this new capability, subscribers to a published Domo Everywhere environment (e.g. the customers of Domo customers) can now automate the process by which they accept published data and share it out within their organizations.
  • Dashboard Embed Exports ‚Äì End users can now export embedded dashboards as a PDF or PowerPoint, including all filters applied and the layout of the dashboard. This will be especially helpful for those utilizing scheduled reports, as they can now export and send the entire dashboard to their audience, rather than creating scheduled reports for individual cards. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/4492108625687-Exporting-Embedded-Content

Governance Toolkit Enhancements: 
  • Observability Metrics ‚Äì With Observability Metrics, customers can pull any and all DomoStats reports across multiple instances into one primary instance, saving time and effort. Additionally, a Domo Access Token Account can be used to assign one common Username/Password combination to pull DomoStats reports from all of their Domo instances. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/8275510785559-Governance-Toolkit-Observability-Metrics
  • Triggered reports - Customers can now schedule reports to trigger on a Dataset update or alert trigger, offering more insight and governance on scheduled reports. https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/9301034807575-Governance-Toolkit-Triggered-Reports

Sandbox enhancements: https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/4403367344023-Domo-Sandbox
  • Connector support ‚Äì Customers who have a connector in their development instance can now transport connectors to test and production instances via Sandbox. This allows them to transport the configuration of that connector across instances, meaning they can now use that connector in different ways for different stages of development.
  • Link mapping ‚Äì Sandbox now allows a user to give a mapping for items in their repository that otherwise wouldn‚Äôt have a clear link. If a user has a page that points to another page that is not in the repository, Sandbox will give the user an opportunity to map the appropriate link during the promotion process.
  • Heuristic content mapping ‚Äì Customers using datasets with key similarities (including name, schema type, and others) will now be able to automate the mapping process across instances using Sandbox. This will be a huge time saver, especially for customers using a common naming convention across instances.



Jupyter Notebooks Enhancements: https://domohelp.domo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360047400753-Jupyter-Workspaces
  • Support for Domo Credentials - Customers using Jupyter Workspaces can now reference Domo credentials directly, providing greater security than raw credentials from notebooks. 
  • Workspace sharing - Jupyter administrators can now enable sharing on Workspaces. With sharing enabled, administrators and owners can now allow different users to edit and run a Workspace by adding them to it, increasing collaboration while maintaining admin control over resources.

title: A List of Domo Developer APIs
author: Jae Myong Wilson
content_markdown:
Help me make a list of all the Domo APIs.
If you have an example of hitting one of the APIs, let me know in the comments and I'll update the documentation.

{
"login":"{}/api/content/v2/authentication",
"customerInfo":"{}/api/domoweb/bootstrap?v2Navigation=true",
"userInfo":"{}/api/content/v2/users/me",
"createPage":"{}/api/content/v1/pages?layout=false",
"getPages":"{}/api/content/v1/pages/adminsummary",
"getPageDetails":"{}/api/content/v3/stacks/{}/cards?includePageLayouts=true&parts=metadata,datasources,drillPathURNs",
"moveCardsToCollection":"{}/api/content/v2/cards/{}/move",
"reorderKpis":"{}/kpis/reorderkpis",
"templates":"{}/api/content/v3/pages/templates",
"createLayout":"{}/api/content/v3/pages/{}/layouts/convert/flowToLayout",
"updateLayout":"{}/api/content/v3/pages/layouts/{}",
"writeLockLayout":"{}/api/content/v3/pages/layouts/{}/writelock",
"getCardList":"{}/access/kpilist",
"getCardTemplate":"{}/api/content/v1/cards/template",
"getCardDefinition":"{}/api/content/v1/cards/kpi/edit?urn={}",
"card":"{}/api/content/v1/cards",
"editCard":"{}/api/content/v1/cards/kpi/{}",
"editDocumentCard":"{}/api/content/v1/cards/{}",
"getDrillCardDetails":"{}/kpis/{}/drillPath/1/drillViewData",
"setCardSize":"{}/kpis/changekpisizes",
"writeLockContent":"{}/domocontent/{}/writelock",
"createNotebook":"{}/api/content/v1/cards/notebook",
"updateNotebook":"{}/api/content/v1/cards/notebook/{}",
"addCardToPages":"{}/api/content/v1/cards/{}/pages",
"getDocumentRevisions":"{}/api/data/v1/data-files/{}/details?expand=revisions",
"readDocumentFile":"{}/api/data/v1/data-files/{}",
"readDocumentFileDetails":"{}/api/data/v1/data-files/{}/details",
"createDocumentFile":"{}/api/data/v1/data-files?name={}",
"readDocPreviewFile":"{}/api/content/v1/doc-previews/{}/{}/PNG",
"filePermissions":"{}/api/data/v1/data-files/{}/permissions",
"updateDocumentFile":"{}/api/data/v1/data-files/{}?public=false&description={}",
"createDocPreview":"{}/api/content/v1/doc-previews/{}/{}",
"getDomoAppCardDetails":"{}/api/content/v2/badges?ids={}",
"getAppDetails":"{}/domoapps/apps/v2/{}",
"getDesignDetails":"{}/domoapps/designs/{}",
"createDomoApp":"{}/domoapps/apps/v2/installation",
"updateDomoAppCard":"{}/domoapps/apps/v2/{}?fullpage=false&cardTitle={}",
"createFusion":"{}/api/query/v1/fusions",
"getFusionDetails":"{}/api/query/v1/fusions/{}",
"dataFlow":"{}/api/dataprocessing/v1/dataflows",
"getDataFlowDetails":"{}/api/dataprocessing/v2/dataflows/{}",
"executeDataFlow":"{}/api/dataprocessing/v1/dataflows/{}/executions",
"getDataFlowStatus":"{}/api/dataprocessing/v1/dataflows/{}/executions/{}",
"createDataSource":"{}/api/data/v2/datasources",
"getDataSourceDetails":"{}/api/data/v3/datasources/{}",
"getDataSourceList":"{}/api/data/ui/v3/datasources/search",
"getSchemaFromDataSource":"{}/api/data/v2/datasources/{}/schemas/indexed",
"writeSchemaToDataSource":"{}/api/data/v2/datasources/{}/schemas",
"getDataFromDataSource":"{}/api/data/v2/datasources/{}/data",
"writeDataToDataSource":"{}/api/data/v3/datasources/{}/dataversions",
"writeDataSourceFormulas":"{}/api/query/v1/functions/bulk/template",
"addTagToDataSource":"{}/api/data/ui/v3/datasources/{}/tags",
"addTagToDataFlow":"{}/api/dataprocessing/v1/dataflows/{}/tags",
"deleteDataSource":"{}/api/data/v3/datasources/{}?deleteMethod=hard",
"design":"{}/domoapps/designs",
"designAssets":"{}/domoapps/designs/{}/versions/{}/assets"
}

## Lineage APIs

api/data/v1/impacts/DATA_SOURCE/{datasource_id}
api/data/v1/lineage/DATAFLOW/{dataflow_id}- query params are: traverseUp=TRUE/FALSE, maxDepth=3, requestEntities = 'DATA_SOURCE', 'DATAFLOW'

## Certification APIs

Get datasource stats using includeAllDetails flag

GET
https://[DOMAIN].[domo.com/api/data/v3/datasources/[DATASET_ID]?includeAllDetails=true](https://domo.com/api/data/v3/datasources/[DATASET_ID]?includeAllDetails=true)

Alternatively, you can gather multiple dataset stats/info using this endpoint:

- Pass in a JSON list of your dataset IDs as the request body

- ["DATASET_ID1","DATASET_ID2"]

POST
https://[DOMAIN].[domo.com/api/data/v3/datasources/bulk?includePrivate=true&includeAllDetails=true](https://domo.com/api/data/v3/datasources/bulk?includePrivate=true&includeAllDetails=true)

## Search APIs

value is one of the following: CERTIFIED, EXPIRED, REQUESTED, PENDING
name is one of the following: Certified, Expired, Requested, Pending

https://[DOMAIN].[domo.com/api/data/ui/v3/datasources/searchBody](https://domo.com/api/data/ui/v3/datasources/searchBody):

{"entities":["DATASET"],"filters":[{"filterType":"term","field":"certification.state","value":"PENDING","name":"Pending","not":false}],"combineResults":true,"query":"*","count":30,"offset":0,"sort":{"isRelevance":false,"fieldSorts":[{"field":"create_date","sortOrder":"DESC"}]}}
## RANDOM FAQs

### Does Domo have a SQL API?

Yes.
[https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-references/data-api#SQL%20API](https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-references/data-api)

### Does Domo support beast Modes?

Yes.

[https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-references/data-api#Beast%20Modes](https://developer.domo.com/docs/dev-studio-references/data-api#Beast%20Modes)

## How to use Full Authentication

[https://datacrew.circle.so/c/developerdomocom-community-edition/full-authentication-with-domo-apis](https://datacrew.circle.so/c/developerdomocom-community-edition/full-authentication-with-domo-apis)

title: Greetings fellow data warriors!
author: Robert Sutton
content_markdown:
My name is Robert and I am a Python & Domo developer.¬† I come seeking refuge from the battles fighting alone.¬† Seems we end up fighting alone grinding away our days when somebody else out there did the same thing and could share their solution.¬† I come here seeking knowledge, comradery and to live the gifted life of the lazy coder!¬† Work smarter, not harder!

I have specialized in using Python to get data into Domo.¬† I run into a lot of issues trying to get data from OMS/CMS system into Domo.¬† In general I find most API's to be a poor source of data for BI needs.¬† The data is mostly raw, has limitations on how much data can be pulled and the data itself tends to be very bland.¬† I prefer to get the data from the OMS/CMS by either SFTP report dumps or web scraping the reports.¬† This allows me to sync large amounts of data daily without the API limitations.¬† Plus I can show the client the same data they will see in their OMS/CMS without data integrity issues.¬† (Ever try pulling data directly from an OMS/CMS SQL server? No thanks!)¬† API's have their place and often I find myself creating my own API interfaces to get data that Domo misses like with Shopify where they don't give you all of the inventory items GRRR!

A year or so ago the Domo Workbench Quickbooks connector stopped working for weeks and I had a client to setup.¬† So I built my own custom Quickbooks Desktop export script in Python which uses the windows scheduler to run the script.¬† I use QODBC and have a developer license so the keys are very reasonable.¬† I will be posting this on here.¬† The cool thing with this script is that it allows me to access ALL tables and reports in Quickbooks.¬† The reports from the Domo Quickbooks tool is limited and has issues.

I am now looking into custom apps to expand my skills so I can be a well rounded Domo developer.¬† I think the 3 areas of focus from my perspective are custom apps, custom connectors and Python data processing.

Cheers and let me know what you think and if you know of any open source Quickbooks financial custom apps, I am all ears!

Ôªø

content_html:
My name is Robert and I am a Python & Domo developer.  I come seeking refuge from the battles fighting alone.  Seems we end up fighting alone grinding away our days when somebody else out there did the same thing and could share their solution.  I come here seeking knowledge, comradery and to live the gifted life of the lazy coder!  Work smarter, not harder!   

I have specialized in using Python to get data into Domo.  I run into a lot of issues trying to get data from OMS/CMS system into Domo.  In general I find most API's to be a poor source of data for BI needs.  The data is mostly raw, has limitations on how much data can be pulled and the data itself tends to be very bland.  I prefer to get the data from the OMS/CMS by either SFTP report dumps or web scraping the reports.  This allows me to sync large amounts of data daily without the API limitations.  Plus I can show the client the same data they will see in their OMS/CMS without data integrity issues.  (Ever try pulling data directly from an OMS/CMS SQL server? No thanks!)  API's have their place and often I find myself creating my own API interfaces to get data that Domo misses like with Shopify where they don't give you all of the inventory items GRRR! 

A year or so ago the Domo Workbench Quickbooks connector stopped working for weeks and I had a client to setup.  So I built my own custom Quickbooks Desktop export script in Python which uses the windows scheduler to run the script.  I use QODBC and have a developer license so the keys are very reasonable.  I will be posting this on here.  The cool thing with this script is that it allows me to access ALL tables and reports in Quickbooks.  The reports from the Domo Quickbooks tool is limited and has issues. 

I am now looking into custom apps to expand my skills so I can be a well rounded Domo developer.  I think the 3 areas of focus from my perspective are custom apps, custom connectors and Python data processing.

Cheers and let me know what you think and if you know of any open source Quickbooks financial custom apps, I am all ears!

ÔªøÔªø

title: My Attempt at a Custom Connector
author: Elliott Leonard
content_markdown:
I recently built a custom connector for a software called Gainsight (it's like the Salesforce of customer success). It was a much longer road than I anticipated, so I decided to share my top 5 learnings. Hopefully this will help you avoid some pitfalls when developing your own custom connectors!

-
**Watch the IDEA exchange session on this topic** ([https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OQLwYgU9smc](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OQLwYgU9smc)). Lacey does an amazing job doing a high-level overview of how to use the custom connector IDE and drops nuggets of wisdom that could save you hours of development time.

-
**Developer.Domo.com is your best friend**. I would highly recommend bookmarking the reference page ([https://developer.domo.com/docs/custom-connectors/reference](https://developer.domo.com/docs/custom-connectors/reference)) as it outlines how to use the methods Domo provides. Since you are coding in Vanilla JavaScript, these are the only custom methods you'll be able to use.

- ¬†**Third-party Connector Support is your 2nd best friend**. This team is awesome to work with, definitely email them ([connectorhelp@domo.com](mailto:connectorhelp@domo.com)) if you're running into issues. They'll also provide comments/feedback after you've submitted your connector for publishing. They were able to help optimize my data processing code, teach me how to process some complicated JSON payloads, and ensure user input was scrubbed to prevent malicious behavior.

-
**Use a tool such as Postman for API testing**. While the custom connector IDE is awesome, it's not meant for API testing. Use a tool such as Postman to test and save the different API requests your custom connector will use. This will rapidly speed up development and testing.

-
**Don't build a custom connector unless it's absolutely necessary**. I know this may sound counterintuitive, but it's the truth. Make sure you explore all other avenues before setting out on the journey to build a custom connector (because believe me, it's a journey). I started development on the Gainsight connector in early December, and it was just published to the AppStore earlier this week. I'd recommend checking out the IDEA Exchange session on Domo's Hidden Gems ([https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lF4VG8lmEVM](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lF4VG8lmEVM)), especially the JSON No Code connector.

title: Domo to Salesforce Write-back
author: Elliott Leonard
content_markdown:
Anyone heard of Domo Integration Cloud? Yeah...me neither üòÇ

Quite possibly the most overlooked *premium* feature of Domo, Integration Cloud allows you to create low-code solutions to many of your more complicated integration problems. In this quick example, I enrich Salesforce accounts with data from my billing and email marketing tools.

Being a premium feature, I'm guessing most of us don't have this enabled in our instances. If you'd like to give Integration Cloud a test drive, you can head over to the dojo instance where we have it enabled. Here's a link: [https://domo-dojo.domo.com/appstore/connectors/com.domo.connector.salesforcewriteback?origin=search](https://domo-dojo.domo.com/appstore/connectors/com.domo.connector.salesforcewriteback?origin=search)

-Elliott

title: Real-time Red Bull Tracker (in Domo!)
author: Elliott Leonard
content_markdown:
If you know me, then you know I drink way too many energy drinks on a weekly basis üòÖ . That's why I decided to create a Domo dashboard for myself to track energy drink consumption (see the public dashboard [HERE](https://public.domo.com/embed/pages/BBjJn)).
Ôªø

[

](#remove-attachment)

[](#left)
[](#full_width)

![](https://datacrew.circle.so/rails/active_storage/representations/redirect/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaHBBNWZUSFE9PSIsImV4cCI6bnVsbCwicHVyIjoiYmxvYl9pZCJ9fQ==--d84eaae4c9c8a55ce0d0ac8fc13cbb23af674cbe/eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6IkJBaDdDRG9MWm05eWJXRjBTU0lJY0c1bkJqb0dSVlE2RkhKbGMybDZaVjkwYjE5c2FXMXBkRnNIYVFJNEJEQTZDbk5oZG1WeWV3WTZDbk4wY21sd1ZBPT0iLCJleHAiOm51bGwsInB1ciI6InZhcmlhdGlvbiJ9fQ==--7535ef66ff04b52d1ea165e904a77a64f9cc7389/Screen%20Shot%202021-11-16%20at%2011.18.10%20AM.png)
Ôªø
The toughest part of this project was figuring out the best way to record when an energy drink was consumed. I settled on using an AWS IoT button (see [HERE](https://www.amazon.com/IoT-Button-AWS-Cloud-Programmable/dp/B0875QVQJW/ref=sr_1_3?keywords=iot+button&qid=1637086151&sr=8-3)) that I attached to the break room fridge. Combine that with Lambda functions (see [HERE](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/welcome.html)) and the Domo Webhook connector (see [HERE](https://www.domo.com/appstore/connector/json-webhook-connector/overview)), and you've got yourself a dataset that refreshes every 15 min!

I love trying to come up with creative data ingestion solutions on Domo. If this post interested you at all, I would highly recommend watching Ôªø
[
Jae Myong Wilson
](https://datacrew.circle.so/u/d8050f8c?show_back_link=true)

Ôªø's conversation with Andy Beier on Domo's "Hidden Gems" (video [HERE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lF4VG8lmEVM)).

-Elliott
